remarks: The object part of the Hom functor is the ` Homf ` operation, which is just a functionalized version of ` Hom ` .  That is, it is a two argument function, which maps ` X , Y ` to the set of morphisms from ` X ` to ` Y ` .  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 15-Jan-2017.)
statement:
hofval.m $e |- M = ( HomF ` C ) $.
hofval.c $e |- ( ph -> C e. Cat ) $.
hof1fval $p |- ( ph -> ( 1st ` M ) = ( Homf ` C ) ) $.
